words:
amateur person who does something (such as a sport or hobby) for pleasure and not as a job Noun
Arena a building for sports and other forms of entertainment that has a large central area surrounded by seats Noun
backhand a way of hitting a ball in tennis and similar games in which the back of the hand holding the racket is turned in the direction of the ball Noun
competitive having a strong desire to win or be the best at something Adjective
goalkeeper a player who defends the goal in various games Noun
finish get to the end of something Verb
defense the act of defending someone or something from attack Noun
mother a female parent Noun
father a male parent Noun
son a male child Noun
daughter a female child Noun
appreciate to understand the worth or importance of Verb
like to enjoy (something) Verb
remain to be left when the other parts are gone or have been used Verb
professionalism the skill, good judgment, and polite behavior that is expected from a person who is trained to do a job well Noun
get to obtain (something) Verb
envy the feeling of wanting to have what someone else has Verb
bias a tendency to believe that some people, ideas, etc., are better than others that usually results in treating some people unfairly Noun
come to move toward someone or something Verb
sentence a group of words that expresses a statement, question, command, or wish Noun
gonna used in writing to represent the sound of the phrase going to when it is spoken quickly Verb
abandon to leave and never return to (someone who needs protection or help) Verb
pervasive existing in every part of something Adjective
evidence something which shows that something else exists or is true Noun
go to move or travel to a place Verb
programming the act or job of creating computer programs Noun
horse a large animal that is used for riding and for carrying and pulling things Noun W
research careful study that is done to find and report new knowledge about something Verb
bear any one of a group of large and heavy animals that have thick hair and sharp claws and that can stand on two legs like a pers Noun
